channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HADOOP-7782] Aggregate project javadocs
item.description:
With 'mvn javadoc:javadoc' we now get docs spread over the maven modules. Is there a way to stich them all together?

Also, there are some differences in their generation: hadoop-auth and hadoop-yarn-* hadoop-mapreduce-* modules goto a top-level apidocs dir which isn't the case for hadoop-common and hadoop-hdfs - they go straight to target/site/api.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
The short answer is "mvn javadoc:aggregate -Dmaxmemory=1024". However, we should only publish the public API, which means we should use the annotation-aware doclet, and we should group the API by project using the groups parameter.

More at http://maven.apache.org/plugins/maven-javadoc-plugin/examples/aggregate.html and http://maven.apache.org/plugins/maven-javadoc-plugin/aggregate-mojo.html

I can look at this one if you like.

I've added a reporting section to the top-level pom, so "mvn site" will generate aggregated Javadoc.

I've added package-level InterfaceAudience annotations to hide non-public APIs in new packages - mainly MR2/YARN (which is why the patch is so big).

I've also added a slightly modified doclet to only include classes that have been explicitly marked @Public (IncludePublicAnnotationsStandardDoclet). Being conservative about what's in the public API is probably a good thing, since its easier to add a class at a later date than to remove one. This is basically done, but there may be a few places where InterfaceAudience should be added.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12501668/HADOOP-7782.patch
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

-1 tests included. The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests.
Please justify why no new tests are needed for this patch.
Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.

-1 patch. The patch command could not apply the patch.

Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HADOOP-Build/343//console

This message is automatically generated.

applied and tested.

Only immediate change to do is that api/ should go under hadoop-project/ (instead of next to it).

+1
Thanks for the review Alejandro. I've updated the patch to fix the relative link to the javadocs.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12501703/HADOOP-7782.patch
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

-1 tests included. The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests.
Please justify why no new tests are needed for this patch.
Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.

-1 patch. The patch command could not apply the patch.

Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HADOOP-Build/346//console

This message is automatically generated.
